name: Cocoa Cherry Pork
author: Chef John
summary: My favorite candy growing up was the chocolate covered cherry. The way that thin, crisp chocolate would break away to reveal the florescent red maraschino cherry suspended in the clear syrup was intoxicating. What about a savory dish that celebrated the same basic flavors?
ingredients: ½ teaspoon ground dried chipotle pepper
directions: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C)
Whisk cocoa powder, ancho chile powder, cumin, black pepper, and chipotle pepper in a bowl
Generously season tenderloins with salt, then coat in the cocoa powder mixture
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat
Place tenderloins in the skillet and reduce heat to medium
Cook until browned on each side, about 4 minutes
Transfer tenderloins to a baking dish; cook in the preheated oven until pork is slightly pink in the center, about 20 minutes
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 145 degrees F (63 degrees C)
Whisk cherry preserves, vinegar, and oregano in a small saucepan over medium heat; bring to a boil and cook 30 seconds
Remove from heat; season with salt and pepper to taste
Spoon sauce over pork tenderloin and serve
